Vue Router: new VueRouter().description:
Create the router instance, The default is hash mode.
Router Construction Options:
- routes: Array<RouteConfig>,
- mode: 'hash' | 'history' | 'abstract' (Node.js),
- base: '/',

Vue Router: route (pass props: Boolean m.description:
Passing Props to Route Components.
When `props` is set to `true`, the `route.params` will be set as the component props.

Vue Router: navigate to path with litera.description:
Router navigate to path.
#syntax:
router.push(location, onComplete?, onAbort?)
router.push(location).then(onComplete).catch(onAbort)

VueRouter navigate to path without pushi.description:
Router navigate to path without pushing a new history entry.
#syntax:
router.push(location, onComplete?, onAbort?)
router.replace(location).then(onComplete).catch(onAbort)

VueRouter navigate to named routes witho.description:
Router navigate to named routes without pushing a new history entry.
#syntax:
router.replace(location, onComplete?, onAbort?)
router.push(location).then(onComplete).catch(onAbort)

VueRouter Programmatically navigate to a.description: This method takes a single integer as parameter that indicates by how many steps to go forwards or go backwards in the history stack.
go backwards in the history stack.
go forwards in the history stack.

VueRouter Reverse URL resolving.description: Given location in form same as used in `<router-link/>`.

VueRouter Global Before Guards.description:
register global before guards.
`beforeEach(callback(to, from, next))`

VueRouter Global Resolve Guards.description:
register global resolve guards.
`beforeResolve(callback(to, from, next))`

VueRouter Per-Route Guard.description:
register guards on a route's configuration object.
`beforeEnter(callback(to, from, next))`

body: 'Do you really want to leave? you have unsaved changes!'
VueRouter In-Component Guards.description: define route navigation guards inside route components

VueRouter Dynamically add more routes to.description:
The argument must be an Array using the same route config format with the `routes` constructor option.
addRoutes(routes)

VueRouter instance method: onReady(callb.description: This method queues a callback to be called when the router has completed the initial navigation, which means it has resolved all async enter hooks and async components that are associated with the initial route.

VueRouter instance method: getMatchedCom.description: Returns an Array of the components (definition/constructor, not instances) matched by the provided location or the current route. This is mostly used during server-side rendering to perform data prefetching.

VueRouter $route.path.description: A string that equals the path of the current route, always resolved as an absolute path.

VueRouter $route.params.description: An object that contains key/value pairs of dynamic segments and star segments. If there are no params the value will be an empty object.

VueRouter $route.query.description: An object that contains key/value pairs of the query string.

VueRouter $route.hash.description: The hash of the current route (with the #), if it has one. If no hash is present the value will be an empty string.

VueRouter $route.fullPath.description: The full resolved URL including query and hash.

VueRouter $route.matched.description: An Array containing route records for all nested path segments of the current route.

VueRouter $route.name.description: The name of the current route, if it has one.

VueRouter $route.redirectedFrom.description: The name of the route being redirected from, if there were one.

VueRouter Fetching After Navigation.description: fetch data in the component's created hook.

body: // when route changes and this component is already rendered,

VueRouter Fetching Before Navigation.description: fetch the data before actually navigating to the new route.
